intro: Stelis brevissimicaudata, commonly known as the short-tailed stelis, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and relatively small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
